section.para: This Issued Letter of Indemnity (or simply Letter of Indemnity) module enables you, on behalf of your company (the applicant), to initiate Letter of Indemnity (LOI or LI) requests, submit them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently amend, follow up and maintain them.

The Letter of Indemnity is often used in Energy & Commodities (particularly Oil) trade transactions to allow the consignee to take delivery of goods without presenting the Bill of Lading (B/L) , which may have been delayed.

In the Oil business, goods often change hands during the course of the shipment in such a way that the B/L has not yet been passed to the previous intermediary in the chain. To retrieve the goods, the next consignee must therefore produce such a letter to the current shipper (company undertaking the transport of the goods). The format of the LOI should be mutually acceptable to both parties and should include title of the cargo, indemnity against non-production of documents such as the B/L, right to deliver bills, legal cost, governing law, and an obligation to put the receiver of the indemnity to funds.

From a Fusion Corporate Channels point of view, the Letter of Indemnity is very similar to the Shipping Guarantee. The main differences are that the latter is more specifically used for global trade rather for Energy & Commodities and the Shipping Company usually submits the form to be countersigned by the bank. In some cases, the LOI can also be issued by the seller towards the buyer.
The chapter for each individual module gives details and differences specific to the module.

section.title: Flow of a LOI
section.para: The life cycle of a Letter of Indemnity generally starts with a request from a customer of the bank asking for its issuance. There is no structured standardized communications from client to bank, and bank to client on a LOI, but such communications may happen and are supported in Fusion Corporate Channels, by the Correspondence feature of feature at the client and the Bank Reporting feature at the bank.

The LOI generally ends with the submission to the bank of some details or documents implying the cancellation of the Letter of Indemnity (for example,. the presentation of the Bill of Lading). This cancellation may happen automatically once required documents are presented under the Letter of Credit (LC) for which the bank acts as the Issuing Bank.

section.title: LOI in Fusion Corporate Channels
section.para: Fusion Corporate Channels implements the applicant side of the customer â€“ bank relationship. The Issued Letter of Indemnity module offers the functions required for the submission of a new LOI request (compatible with both cases highlighted above: LOI for the shipper or LOI for the buyer) and the capability for both the applicant and the bank to further engage in free format communications about the request.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The guide uses the terms like "LI", "Letter Of Indemnity", "Issued Letter of Indemnity" and "LOI" interchangeably.
The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

Full Data: Downloads all the transactions available under a particular status tab like Draft, Rejected and more.

Displays the transaction details, all the events of transaction, attachments and charges associated with the transaction. The information is spread over three tabs 'Transaction Details', 'Events' and 'Additional Information'. Individual tabs are described below:
Transaction Details: Displays the details of the transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab lists the fields based on the action you click against the transaction.
Events: Displays the history of events that transaction has gone through. The transactions are either acknowledged by the bank or a reporting event is initiated by bank that requires an action to be performed by a corporate user.

Existing LI: Create a Letter of Indemnity initiation from an existing Letter of Indemnity. This is typically where your company is the buyer and you are requesting an LI in favour of the shipper.
This function displays a list of your company's existing Letters of Indemnity. "Existing" means, those transactions that have been approved by the bank.
Existing LC: Create a Letter of Indemnity initiation from an existing Import Letter of Credit or Issued Standby Letter of Credit. This is typically where your company is the buyer and you are requesting an LI in favour of the shipper.
This function displays a list of your company's existing Import Letters of Credit and Issued Standby Letters of Credit. "Existing" means, those transactions that have been approved by the bank. The two types can be distinguished by the product code that the system ID starts with - LC for an Import Letter of Credit, and SI for an Issued Standby Letter of Credit.
Existing EL: Create a Letter of Indemnity initiation from an existing Export Letter of Credit or Received Standby Letter of Credit. This is typically where your company is the seller and you are requesting an LOI in favour of the buyer.
